curam.util.persistence.validation.customizable

Interface ValidationContextFactory


  • public interface ValidationContextFactory
    Factory to obtain ValidationContext instances for validations. The factory returns ValidationContexts for the validation methods on the validator interface on behalf of which it is acting.

    To use, obtain a concrete instance of ValidationContextFactory for a particular validations interface from the ValidationContextFactorySupplier class. Then, use the methods on this interface to obtain ValidationContext types for the validator methods on the validations interface.

    See Also:
    ValidationContextFactorySupplier, ValidationContext

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValidationContext[] all()
      Return an array of ValidationContext types containing an element for each validation method on the validation interface on behalf of which the ValidationContextFactory instance is operating.
      ValidationContext get(java.lang.String simpleValidationMethodName)
      Returns the ValidationContext for the method with the name specified.

    • Method Detail

      • all

        ValidationContext[] all()
        Return an array of ValidationContext types containing an element for each validation method on the validation interface on behalf of which the ValidationContextFactory instance is operating.

        Example: If a ValidationContextFactory named factory has been created for the validation interface curam.sample.PersonCustomizableValidator where the interface has validation methods validateFirstName and validateLastName, then calling factory.all() will return an array of ValidationContext types with elements for both the validateFirstName and validateLastName methods.

        Note that this method does not affect the tracking of validations performed by a tracking ValidationContextFactory. That is, it will not affect and is not affected by calls to the ValidationContextFactory.get(String) method.

        Returns:
        An array of type ValidationContext with elements for all validation methods on the validation interface on behalf of which the ValidationContextFactory instance is operating.

      • get

        ValidationContext get(java.lang.String simpleValidationMethodName)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the ValidationContext for the method with the name specified.

        Example: If a ValidationContextFactory named factory has been created for the validation interface curam.sample.PersonCustomizableValidator with validation methods validateFirstName and validateLastName, then calling factory.get("validateFirstName") will return a ValidationContext for the validateFirstName method.

        Note that if the ValidationContextFactory is a tracking factory (i.e. obtained from the ValidationContextFactorySupplier.getTrackingFactory(Class) method), then this method can only be called once for each validation method on the validation interface. Repeated calls for a particular method will result in an IllegalArgumentException being raised.

        Parameters:
        simpleValidationMethodName - The (unscoped) validation method name.
        Returns:
        A ValidationContext for the validation method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the validation method name is not valid - e.g. does not exist or has already been returned by a tracking factory.
